{{cpp/numeric/random/uniform_real_distribution/title|uniform_real_distribution}}
{{cpp/numeric/random/uniform_real_distribution/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++11|1=
uniform_real_distribution() : uniform_real_distribution(0.0) { }
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++11|1=
explicit uniform_real_distribution( RealType a, RealType b = 1.0 );
}}
{{dcl|num=3|since=c++11|1=
explicit uniform_real_distribution( const param_type&amp; params );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Constructs a new distribution object.
@2@ Uses {{c|a}} and {{c|b}} as the distribution parameters.
@3@ Uses {{c|params}} as the distribution parameters.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|a|the ''a'' distribution parameter (minimum value)}}
{{par|b|the ''b'' distribution parameter (maximum value)}}
{{par|params|the distribution parameter set}}
{{par end}}

===Notes===
Requires that {{c|a ≤ b}} and {{c| b - a ≤ std::numeric_limits&lt;RealType&gt;::max()}}.

If {{c|1=a == b}}, subsequent calls to the {{ltt|cpp/numeric/random/uniform_real_distribution/operator()|operator()}} overload that does not accept a {{tt|param_type}} object will cause undefined behavior.

To create a distribution over the closed interval {{math|[a,b]}}, {{c|std::nextafter(b, std::numeric_limits&lt;RealType&gt;::max())}} may be used as the second parameter.
